info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 4:12PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN RIO ARRIBA, NORTHEASTERN SANTA FE AND WEST CENTRAL MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Truchas, or 9 miles east of Chimayo, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pojoaque, Cundiyo, Nambe Lake, Nambe Pueblo, Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, Truchas, Cuyamungue, Cordova, Chupadero and Rio Chiquito. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
